173.question: What stylistic features are used to detect drunk texts?
173.response: {'Answer': 'Stylistic features used to detect drunk texts include Spelling Errors, Capitalization, Length, Part-of-speech (POS) ratios for nouns, adjectives, and adverbs, number of repeated characters, sentiment ratio (positive and negative words), and LDA topics.'}
173.answer:
LDA unigrams (Presence/Count), POS Ratio, #Named Entity Mentions, #Discourse Connectors,  Spelling errors, Repeated characters, Capitalisation, Length,  Emoticon (Presence/Count ) 
 and Sentiment Ratio

174.question: What stylistic features are used to detect drunk texts?
174.response: {'Answer': 'Stylistic features used to detect drunk texts include spelling errors, the ratio of nouns, adjectives and adverbs in the text, capitalization, the length of the text, whether characters are repeated three times consecutively, and the ratio of positive and negative words.'}
174.answer: LDA unigrams (Presence/Count), POS Ratio, #Named Entity Mentions, #Discourse Connectors, Spelling errors, Repeated characters, Capitalization, Length, Emoticon (Presence/Count), Sentiment Ratio.
